Comment: Going after Google's ad tech would effectively cripple Google.  I'm not a fan of Google, but they provide a lot of services that other companies are struggling to replicate.  Ripping out a core pillar of Google like this will hurt everyone.   Something tells me crippling Google is the point.
Author: silver0199

Comment: Why is the DOJ so fixated on Google?  Apple, Microsoft, Meta, Amazon all must be sheepishly looking the other way right about now.....
Author: zambabamba

Comment: The US Department of Justice filed a plan in court to make Google divest its advertising marketplace and ad management platform, part of a proposal to address the company’s “decade-long campaign of exclusionary conduct,” which a judge has declared violates antitrust law.  On Monday, the DOJ and Google both filed requests for remedying the tech giant’s legally declared ad-tech monopoly. The DOJ plan proposes having Google sell two major pieces of its business: its Ad Exchange (AdX) and its ad management platform DoubleClick for Publishers (DFP), which is now called Google Ad Manager. Google, which plans to appeal the original verdict, asks the court to require targeted changes in certain business practices while leaving the company intact.  Read more: [https://www.theverge.com/news/661833/google-ad-tech-business-doj-break-up](https://www.theverge.com/news/661833/google-ad-tech-business-doj-break-up)
Author: theverge

Comment: I don't think this would cripple Google at all because these are programs for publishers (websites, apps) and not where they actually make their money: Google Search / AdWords (~75%) and then YT (~15%).
